intro: Coutinia, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to the Americas. The plants are characterized by their showy, often brightly colored flowers that resemble those of hibiscus. They typically have palmate leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Coutinia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are adapted to a variety of soil types and climates.
